intro: Philydrella pygmaea subsp. pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf philydra, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers during the warmer months. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand high salinity and drought conditions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
